intro: Anisodus carniolicoides, commonly known as the Carpathian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soils. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Anisodus carniolicoides is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cooler, moist environments.
